items.summary: Max Verstappen has won the previous two grands prix in Formula 1, but this weekend's race in Singapore is the only circuit on the calendar on which he has never triumphed.

items.title: Players to watch this Sheffield Shield season ahead of Ashes Test summer

items.title: Menindee fish passage trial aimed at preventing mass deaths enters second stage
items.summary: A fish passage that connects the Darling River with Lake Wetherell in order to redistribute native fish is being trialled with the aim of preventing more ecological disasters.

items.title: Jarred Drew Heath pleads guilty after pointing replica gun at police in Gatton caravan park
items.summary: Jarred Drew Heath told police he wished he had a bullet and an "AK" to shoot officers with.

items.title: Afghan women's refugee team return to international football amid calls for more autonomy
items.summary: Australian-based players headline the Afghan women's refugee football team preparing to play for the first time since the Taliban takeover in 2021, but they're still pushing for greater autonomy over their future.

items.title: Appeal for help over body in burnt-out SUV on Kamilaroi Highway near Brewarrina
items.summary: Detectives have a possible identity for a body in a burnt-out station wagon in north-west New South Wales and have appealed for more information.

items.title: Proposal for Gaza's future governance revealed in leaked draft plan

items.summary: A landmark defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has been approved by PNG's cabinet, marking Australia first new alliance in more than 70 years.

items.summary: The death of Chris Robertson, whose body was found at an industrial site in Adelaide's south on Tuesday, is now being treated as a major crime, police say.

items.title: First survey in five years shows feral deer population boom in Tasmania

items.title: China's K visa scheme has some worrying about jobs in a country already facing challenges
items.summary: The new visa is designed to attract top global STEM talent but has sparked fierce backlash, with critics warning it could squeeze Chinese nationals out of the graduate job market.

items.summary: The Reserve Bank warns risks to the global financial system are "rising", not receding, and Australia is not immune from any fallout.

items.summary: At 29, Australian musician Jordan Brunoli was diagnosed with incurable cancer. He says he's terrified of what comes next.

items.summary: Robyne Burridge lives with a disability that severely impacts her mobility, and hydrotherapy is vital. But she hasn't received that treatment in months after the NT government cut off public access to the only suitable local facility.

items.summary: Roosters fullback James Tedesco held off the challenge of players over a decade his junior to defy time and claim his second Dally M player of the year award.

items.summary: Police are looking for a Sydney rapper they believe fled the country after a gangland murder where a man was ambushed and gunned down at an inner-city service station in 2024.

items.summary: A plan that will enable a state-of-the-art medical facility with 10 operating theatres, a laboratory, pharmacy, helipad and a bridge to Launceston's public hospital is unanimously supported by all Launceston councillors in a vote.

items.summary: The family of an Indigenous man who died in prison says an apology from Corrective Services NSW has come "too little, too late".

items.title: VPNs, 'old man' masks, and AI: The holes in the social media ban and their fixes
items.summary: From December 10, social media platforms will be forced to block under 16s in Australia from holding accounts, but experts warn age checks can be easily bypassed in several ways, including a $22 "old man" mask.

items.title: The oceans keep score in a year of record heat around Australia
items.summary: For the past year, Australia's oceans have been hotter than ever before. The impacts are being felt all across the nation — as far away from the coast as you can get.

items.title: Calls to reform Australia's pension age as labourers consider early retirement due to injury
items.summary: For some Australians, continuing to work until the pension age of 67 can be a struggle. Peita says a life of heavy lifting has taken its toll on her body, and she is trying to survive on JobSeeker payments.

items.title: Greta Thunberg detained as Israel's military intercepts Gaza-bound aid flotilla
items.summary: The activists are expected to be detained and then taken to Ashdod, where they will be told to sign deportation orders and flown out of the country.

items.title: Five people pulled alive from site of Indonesia school collapse as rescuers race against time to find others
items.summary: Authorities say those rescued alive were able to communicate with rescuers, with another three people killed in the disaster also pulled from the rubble.

items.title: Social media and online dating exposes girls to greater risks of child marriage, new report shows
items.summary: Modern technology is allowing girls to choose their own partners but some remain vulnerable to child marriage to escape hardship.

items.title: Jane Goodall, renowned conservationist, dies aged 91

items.summary: Witnesses reported heavy bombardment in Gaza City, as Israel's defence minister, Israel Katz, said the army was tightening its encirclement of the city.

items.title: The number of large companies paying no tax in Australia has declined, says ATO
items.summary: The proportion of large companies in Australia that paid no tax in the most recent income year has declined from 36 per cent to 28 per cent over the past 11 years.

items.title: Former employees of sunscreen testing lab Princeton Consumer Research blow whistle on alleged questionable practices
items.summary: Two former employees of a leading international testing laboratory used by major Australian sunscreen brands have blown the whistle on alleged questionable data and incorrect testing practices, amid ongoing concerns about whether consumers can trust the products they are relying on for sun protection.

items.title: Cats apologise for 'inappropriate' Mad Monday behaviour, AFL 'not thrilled'
items.summary: Geelong breaks its silence about the club's Mad Monday antics, revealing future post-season events "will not continue in this current form".

items.summary: At just 18 years old, Kristelle would step through the gates of a music festival in Sydney's west and leave feeling like she had been sexually assaulted.

items.title: Queensland youth worker jailed for nine years for 22 child exploitation offences
